backend/main.mo: Main backend actor implementing access control, user profiles, video/channel/course management, membership tiers, subscriptions, playlists, donations, comments, and Stripe integration with blob storage for media files.
backend/migration.mo: Data migration module defining OldActor and NewActor types to handle schema evolution, adding viewCount field to videos during upgrades.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting three implemented features: video settings editor, course settings editor, and personalized course recommendations with associated files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend components, pages, and hooks including video/course editing, personalized recommendations, authentication, channel management, and Stripe integration.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Video Sharing Platform MVP with root div and module script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component configuring QueryClient, ThemeProvider, AuthProvider, and TanStack Router with routes for all pages including upload, watch, channel, courses, playlists, and payment flows.
frontend/src/components/AddToPlaylistDia: Dialog component allowing users to add videos to existing playlists or create new playlists with title, description, and visibility settings.
frontend/src/components/CategoryFilter.t: Renders a horizontal scrollable list of category filter buttons (All, Music, Gaming, Education, Vlog, Comedy, Other) with active state styling.
frontend/src/components/CourseCard.tsx: Displays a course card with title, description, video count, and access requirements (free, tier-locked, or paid), with appropriate action buttons for starting or purchasing the course.
frontend/src/components/CreateChannelDia: Modal dialog for creating a new channel with name and description fields, generating a unique channel ID and associating it with the authenticated user's principal.
frontend/src/components/CreateCourseDial: Modal dialog for creating a course with title, description, pricing/tier options, and video selection from the channel's existing videos.
frontend/src/components/DonateDialog.tsx: Modal dialog for making one-time donations to a channel with preset amounts, custom amount input, and optional message field.
frontend/src/components/DonationsFeed.ts: Displays a feed of the 10 most recent donations to a channel, showing donor avatar, name, amount, message, and timestamp with loading and empty states.
frontend/src/components/EditChannelDialo: Modal dialog for editing an existing channel's name and profile description, pre-populated with current channel data.
frontend/src/components/EditCourseDialog: Dialog component for editing course details including title, description, price, membership tier requirements, video selection, visibility, and course image upload with progress tracking.
frontend/src/components/EditStripeAccoun: Dialog component for creating or updating Stripe account configurations with fields for account name, secret key, connect ID, and payout settings, including secret key visibility toggle.
Dialog component for editing video metadata including title, description, category, privacy settings, membership tier requirements, and thumbnail upload with progress tracking.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Simple footer component displaying copyright notice and attribution to caffeine.ai with a heart icon.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Main navigation header with logo, search functionality, authentication controls, and dropdown menu for user profile, subscriptions, liked videos, courses, and settings.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Root layout component that wraps the application with Header and Footer, displaying a loading spinner during authentication initialization.
frontend/src/components/MembershipTiersS: Displays channel membership tiers in a grid with pricing, descriptions, and subscription buttons, showing current tier status and access levels for authenticated users.
frontend/src/components/PersonalizedCour: Displays personalized course recommendations based on user activity, showing different states for unauthenticated users, loading, empty results, and populated course cards with navigation to course playback.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog that prompts authenticated users without a profile to enter their name for initial profile creation, blocking further interaction until completed.
frontend/src/components/ProtectedRoute.t: Route wrapper that redirects unauthenticated users and shows a loading spinner during auth initialization before rendering protected content.
frontend/src/components/StripeAccountsLi: Manages display and CRUD operations for user Stripe accounts, showing connection status badges and providing dialogs for creating, editing, and deleting payment accounts.
frontend/src/components/StripeConfigurat: Admin-only modal that appears when Stripe is not configured, allowing platform administrators to set the Stripe secret key and allowed countries for payment processing.
frontend/src/components/VideoCard.tsx: Displays a video thumbnail with metadata including title, channel info, views, upload time, and badges for private/members-only content and category.
frontend/src/components/VideoCardWithAct: Extended video card component that adds edit and delete action buttons with confirmation dialogs for video management by channel owners.
frontend/src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx: Provides authentication context using Internet Identity, managing auth status (initializing/authenticated/unauthenticated), identity, and login/logout functions.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages the backend actor with proper identity, initializes access control on authentication, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity authentication provider and hook, managing AuthClient lifecycle, identity persistence, login flow, and delegation validation.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend operations including user profiles, videos, channels, subscriptions, courses, playlists, donations, and Stripe integration.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light/dark themes, including colors for UI components, charts, and sidebar elements.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up QueryClient, InternetIdentityProvider, and renders the root App component.
Displays channel analytics dashboard with metrics for subscribers, monthly revenue, donations, and membership tiers, restricted to channel owners.
frontend/src/pages/ChannelPage.tsx: Main channel page showing videos, courses, membership tiers, and donations with follow/unfollow functionality and owner-specific actions like settings and upload.
frontend/src/pages/ChannelSettingsPage.t: Channel settings page for owners to manage membership tiers, Stripe account connections, and tier CRUD operations with dialogs for creating/editing/deleting tiers.
Course management page for channel owners to view, create, and edit courses with dialogs for course CRUD operations.
frontend/src/pages/CoursePlayerPage.tsx: Course player page displaying course details with edit functionality for channel owners.
frontend/src/pages/FollowingPage.tsx: Protected page showing a grid of channels the authenticated user follows with links to view each channel.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Main landing page displaying personalized courses section, category filter, and a grid of all videos with loading and error states.
frontend/src/pages/MyChannelsPage.tsx: Protected page listing user's owned channels with create channel dialog and links to manage each channel.
frontend/src/pages/PaymentFailurePage.ts: Payment cancellation page showing failure message for subscriptions or donations with navigation back to channel or home.
frontend/src/pages/PaymentSuccessPage.ts: Displays a success confirmation page after payment completion, showing different messages for subscriptions vs donations and providing navigation buttons back to the channel or home page.
frontend/src/pages/PlaylistEditPage.tsx: Provides a page for editing playlist details, fetching playlist data by ID and displaying loading/error states with a basic card layout showing playlist title and description.
frontend/src/pages/PlaylistPlayerPage.ts: Implements a playlist video player with sequential playback controls (next/previous/shuffle/repeat), displaying the current video alongside a scrollable list of all playlist videos.
frontend/src/pages/PlaylistsPage.tsx: Displays the authenticated user's playlists in a list view, showing playlist titles and video counts with loading states and empty state messaging.
frontend/src/pages/ProfileSettingsPage.t: Protected page allowing users to update their profile name and view their principal ID, with form validation and integration with StripeAccountsList component for payment account management.
frontend/src/pages/SearchPage.tsx: Displays search results for videos based on query parameters, showing a grid of video cards with loading skeletons and empty state messaging when no results are found.
frontend/src/pages/SubscriptionsPage.tsx: Shows the user's active channel subscriptions/memberships with authentication check, currently displaying an empty state placeholder for future subscription management features.
frontend/src/pages/UploadPage.tsx: Provides a video upload form for channel owners with fields for title, description, category, video/thumbnail files, and optional membership tier restrictions, including authorization checks and validation.
frontend/src/pages/WatchPage.tsx: Video watch page component that displays video player, channel info, like/share buttons, comments section, and handles video access control based on subscription tiers. Includes edit functionality for video owners via EditVideoDialog.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration file defining custom color schemes using OKLCH color space, container settings, border radius variables, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file documenting a video learning platform with three main features: video settings editor, course settings editor, and personalized course recommendations based on user activity.
